page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: Kineton is situated in an undulating landscape in a valley bounded by Edge Hill (Cotswold Range) to the south and some low-lying hills of the Midland Plain to the north. The valley has been produced by a small brook called the River Dene. The oldest part of the village is still the centre where a number of old stone houses, some thatched, others slated, date back to the seventeenth century. A little development took place early this century but most of the "outer" village has been built since the war. {Building materials}in the village are a mixture of stones and modern brick. The church and other buildings are constructed with Cotswold and Hornton ironstone, others of blue lias limestone which tends to flake as it weathers.
